results.title: Only one House Republican who voted for a Jan. 6 inquiry has lost a primary so far.
results.abstract: Eleven of 14 incumbents have won their primaries, with two contests still to be determined. Primary challenges still await a dozen more.

media.caption: Representative Liz Cheney’s race in Wyoming has drawn national attention, and a Trump-endorsed opponent.
media.copyright: Stephen Speranza for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Uvalde, Tex, Shooting (May 24, 2022);School Shootings and Armed Attacks;Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;Ramos, Salvador (d 2022);Mireles, Eva (1978-2022);Robb Elementary School (Uvalde, Tex);Uvalde (Tex)
results.title: Aware of Injuries Inside, Uvalde Police Waited to Confront Gunman
results.abstract: More than a dozen students remained alive for over an hour before officers entered their classrooms. The commander feared a risk to officers’ lives, new documents show.

media.caption: An outdoor hallway at Robb Elementary School. The police response to a mass shooting there is now the subject of overlapping investigations by the Texas state police and the U.S. Justice Department.
media.copyright: Ivan Pierre Aguirre for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Politics and Government;Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Airlines and Airplanes;Propaganda;Aviation Accidents, Safety and Disasters;United States International Relations;International Relations;Defense and Military Forces;Territorial Disputes;China
results.title: Chinese Pilots Sent a Message. American Allies Said They Went Too Far.
results.abstract: Australia and Canada said Chinese jets harassed their military planes, though Beijing says it was defending its security. A mishap over Pacific waters could have ominous repercussions.

media.caption: A Chinese J-16 fighter jet, in an undated photo released by Taiwan’s defense ministry. Australia said a J-16 harassed one of its surveillance planes over the South China Sea last month.
media.copyright: Taiwan Ministry of Defense, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Coffee;Coffeehouses;Schultz, Howard D;Starbucks Corporation
results.title: Starbucks’s C.E.O. Howard Schultz: ‘I don’t know if we can keep our bathrooms open.’
results.abstract: Speaking at The Times’s DealBook D.C. policy forum, Howard Schultz said safety concerns have prompted Starbucks to reconsider its 2018 policy on customer use of restrooms.

media.caption: Howard Schultz, Starbucks’s interim chief executive. He rejoined the company in the role last month.
media.copyright: Amanda Andrade-Rhoades for The New York Times

results.byline: By Annie Karni and Catie Edmondson
results.title: As Survivors Demand Action, House Passes Gun Bill Doomed in the Senate
results.abstract: On a day of wrenching testimony from victims of the school shooting in Uvalde, Democrats pushed through a gun control package facing solid G.O.P. opposition and no path in the Senate.

results.adx_keywords: Customs, Etiquette and Manners;Content Type: Service
results.title: Can I Tell My Parents That Their Estate Plan Hurts My Feelings?
results.abstract: A reader is upset that her brother and each of his children will inherit the same amount as she does.

results.title: White House Outlines Coronavirus Vaccine Plan for Children Under 5
results.abstract: Vaccine deliveries to U.S. states are contingent on the Food and Drug Administration authorizing pediatric doses, a step that could occur as soon as next week.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

results.adx_keywords: Aviation Accidents, Safety and Disasters;Military Aircraft;Helicopters;United States Marine Corps;El Centro (Calif)
results.byline: By Eduardo Medina and Christine Chung
results.title: Five Marines Dead in Military Plane Crash in California
results.abstract: All aboard the plane, an MV-22B Osprey that belonged to the 3rd Marine Aircraft Wing, crashed in a remote area east of San Diego, the U.S. Marine Corps said.

media.caption: A U.S. Marine MV-22B Osprey during an exercise near El Centro, Calif., last year.

results.adx_keywords: Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Right-Wing Extremism and Alt-Right;Presidential Election of 2020;United States Politics and Government;Trump, Donald J;Quested, Nick;Proud Boys;House of Representatives
results.title: ‘Trump Was at the Center’: Jan. 6 Hearing Lays Out Case in Vivid Detail
results.abstract: The House panel investigating the attack led its public sessions with video testimony from people close to the former president about his actions before and during the riot.

media.caption: Footage of the attack on the Capitol was shown on a television screen inside the hearing room on Thursday.
media.copyright: Kenny Holston for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Golf;Mickelson, Phil;Johnson, Dustin;Rumayyan, Yasir al-;LIV Golf;PGA Tour Inc
results.title: ‘This Is Uncomfortable’: Saudi Arabia Upends Genteel World of Pro Golf
results.abstract: By promising top players multimillion-dollar paydays, the kingdom moved beyond investing in a sport and made a play to control one. Then the PGA Tour struck back.

media.caption: Phil Mickelson is one of the prize catches for the new LIV Golf Invitational Series. He reportedly is receiving $200 million to take part.

results.adx_keywords: Uvalde, Tex, Shooting (May 24, 2022);Children and Childhood
results.title: An Uvalde pediatrician says he will ‘never forget what I saw’ after the shooting.
results.abstract: Dr. Roy Guerrero described to members of Congress on Wednesday the horrors he experienced as he treated wounded and dying students.

results.adx_keywords: Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;Illegal Immigration;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Decisions and Verdicts;Boule, Robert;Egbert, Erik (Border Patrol Agent);Border Patrol (US);Supreme Court (US);Blaine (Wash)
results.title: Supreme Court Sides With Border Agent Accused of Using Excessive Force
results.abstract: In a 6-to-3 decision, the justices made it harder to sue federal officials for money in cases accusing them of violating the Constitution.

media.caption: The basic message of Wednesday’s decision, Egbert v. Boule, was that only Congress can authorize such lawsuits against federal officials.
media.copyright: Ilana Panich-Linsman for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Colon and Colorectal Cancer;Drugs (Pharmaceuticals);Clinical Trials;Research;Immunotherapy;Dostarlimab (Drug);American Society of Clinical Oncology;New England Journal of Medicine;GlaxoSmithKline PLC
results.title: A Cancer Trial’s Unexpected Result: Remission in Every Patient
results.abstract: The study was small, and experts say it needs to be replicated. But for 18 people with rectal cancer, the outcome led to “happy tears.”

media.caption: Sascha Roth, the first patient in the trial, unexpectedly learned she had rectal cancer in 2019. Her gastroenterologist, she recalled, told her during a sigmoidoscopy, “Oh no. I was notexpecting this!”
media.copyright: Shuran Huang for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: your-feed-science;Monkeypox;Masks;Smallpox;Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.title: Monkeypox Can Be Airborne, Too
results.abstract: An abrupt change in C.D.C. guidance underscores a little-known phenomenon: On occasion, monkeypox can be transmitted through aerosols, similar to the coronavirus.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

media.caption: Scientists say that the monkeypox virus can be airborne, although that route of transmission is only a small contributor to its overall spread.
media.copyright: Erika P. Rodriguez for The New York Times

results.title: Colorado to Examine Lauren Boebert’s Mileage Claims and Tax Liens
results.abstract: The state’s attorney general has referred for review a fraud complaint from the group that targeted Representative Madison Cawthorn, in a sign of trouble for the first-term congresswoman.

media.caption: Aides to Representative Lauren Boebert, Republican of Colorado, said on Wednesday that she had accounted for the mileage she logged on the campaign trail in 2020.

results.byline: By Elizabeth G. Dunn and Gabby Jones
results.title: How ‘Fairy Tale’ Farms Are Ruining Hudson Valley Agriculture
results.abstract: Farmers are losing properties to wealthy buyers from the city, while leasing land from the new owners can feel like a “modern-day feudal system.”

media.copyright: Gabby Jones for The New York Times

results.title: Armed Man Traveled to Justice Kavanaugh’s Home to Kill Him, Officials Say
results.abstract: The man, Nicholas John Roske, 26, said he was upset about the shooting in Uvalde, Texas, and impending decisions on abortion and guns, a federal affidavit says.

media.caption: Justice Brett M. Kavanaugh in 2019. An armed man was arrested near his home in Chevy Chase, Md., early Wednesday.

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);Prisoners of War
results.title: Russia Opens 1,100 Cases Against Ukrainian P.O.W.s, Raising Fears of Show Trials
results.abstract: Announcing the invasion in February, Vladimir Putin said Ukrainians would be prosecuted for “blood crimes.” Moscow is now making good on that vow.

media.caption: Ukrainian soldiers who had been fighting in the Azovstal steel plant after surrendering to Russian-backed forces last month.

results.title: Boston Celtics Withstand Stephen Curry for Game 3 Win in N.B.A. Finals
results.abstract: Golden State’s Curry had 31 points, including six 3-pointers, but Jaylen Brown, Marcus Smart and Jayson Tatum had big games of their own for Boston.

media.caption: Boston’s Jaylen Brown, left, finished with 27 points, 9 rebounds and 5 assists. He was sharp from the field, hitting 9 of 16 shots.

results.adx_keywords: Theater;Actors and Actresses;Books and Literature;Bullies;#MeToo Movement;Butler, Isaac D (1979- );Stanislavsky, Constantin;Kazan, Elia;Strasberg, Lee;Fosse, Bob;Robbins, Jerome;Rudin, Scott;Rivera, Chita;Olivo, Karen;Childress, Alice
results.title: Is It Finally Twilight for the Theater’s Sacred Monsters?
results.abstract: Many of the “great men” who helped America create its classics, its institutions and its own acting style were tyrants. We need to cut them loose.
